Suburban Pembroke Pines is a pretty, well-kept community of condominiums, lush townhouses, and expansive man-made lakes and shopping strips. As a typical rule, the further west one travels, the more opulence the lifestyle entails. Pembroke Pines is a decent shopping destination for South Florida, but functions mainly as a suburb for the more urban nearby

Broward County Transit runs route #7 along Pines Bolulevard hitting all the main shopping centers and Pembroke Lakes Mall, but due to the highly suburban nature of this citty, driving is nearly a must. Be careful though, as the local drivers have a poor reputation and ignore turn signals, road lines, speed limits, etc. Note that the intersection of Pines Boulevard and Flamingo Road is ranked among the ten most dangerous in the US.
